summary: This is an email chain between prosecutors and defense attorneys regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell trial, specifically concerning the exchange of draft verdict forms and proposed stipulations. It shows coordination on trial procedures and evidence authentication ahead of a court conference.

events.title: Prosecution sends second set of proposed stipulations
events.description: Prosecutors send a second set of proposed stipulations to defense counsel regarding exhibits and seek agreement ahead of a Wednesday conference.

events.title: Prosecution sends draft verdict form and initial stipulations
events.description: Prosecutors send a draft joint proposed request to charge, a verdict sheet, and four proposed stipulations to defense counsel, requesting a response by November 5.

locations: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is email correspondence between prosecutors and Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team regarding trial preparations.
Prosecutors are seeking agreement on stipulations for self-authenticating exhibits to streamline trial proceedings.
A verdict sheet and proposed jury instructions were circulated, indicating the trial was in its final stages or approaching deliberation.
The correspondence shows procedural coordination between the prosecution and defense ahead of a court conference scheduled for a Wednesday.
Attachments referenced include exhibits and depositions, likely intended for use as evidence in the trial.
